word_mean: 屠体，动物尸体：一般指除人以外的尸体

sentence.Network_en: The hunter knelt beside the animal carcass and commenced to skin it.
sentence.Network_cn: 猎人跪在动物尸体旁边，开始剥皮。

sentence.Network_en: A cluster of vultures crouched on the carcass of a dead buffalo.
sentence.Network_cn: 一群秃鹫蹲伏在一具野牛的尸体上。

sentence.Network_en: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the carcass of the deer.
sentence.Network_cn: 秃鹰在天空盘旋等着啄食鹿的尸体.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French carcois, variant of Old French charcois; in later use from French carcasse; of unknown ultimate origin

entry.def: A carcass is the body of a dead animal.

example.ex: A cluster of vultures crouched on the carcass of a dead buffalo...
example.tran: 一群秃鹫蹲伏在一具野牛的尸体上。

example.ex: Prepare the chicken stock using the carcases, the diced vegetables and herbs.
example.tran: 做鸡汤的用料有鸡肉、切成块的蔬菜和香料。

entry.tran: (车辆、建筑物破损或被毁后的)骨架,残体
entry.def: The carcass of a vehicle or building is its remains after most of it has decayed or been destroyed.

example.tran: 一辆生锈的拖拉机残骸

means.word_mean: 1. the dead body of an animal especially one slaughtered and dressed for food

auth_sentence.content: Discard chicken carcass and reserve ribs for another use.
auth_sentence.res_content: Discard chicken carcass and reserve ribs for another use.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Discard chicken carcass and reserve ribs for another use.

auth_sentence.content: Roughly chop the carcass and place in a saucepan.
auth_sentence.res_content: Roughly chop the carcass and place in a saucepan.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Roughly chop the carcass and place in a saucepan.

auth_sentence.content: Gently fry the carcass with shallots, brandy and peppercorns.
auth_sentence.res_content: Gently fry the carcass with shallots, brandy and peppercorns.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gently fry the carcass with shallots, brandy and peppercorns.

stems_affixes.word_buile: in进入+carn肉,肉欲+ate表形容词→adj.具有肉体的,化身的
carc=carn肉,肉欲+ass表名词→n.[动物]尸体;残骸
carn肉,肉欲+age状态,总称→把人变成一堆肉→大屠杀
carn肉,肉欲+ation→这种花粉红色[肉色的]
carn肉,肉欲+ival节日→肉的节日→放荡肉欲的狂欢节日
re再+incarnate[v.体现,化身]→v.再具肉体,转生

sentences.en: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the carcass of the deer.
sentences.cn: 秃鹰在天空盘旋等着啄食鹿的尸体。

sentences.en: You can make soup by boiling chicken carcasses.

jushi.english: Divers have found the carcass of a wrecked ship 100 miles from the coast.
jushi.chinese: 潜水员在离岸100英里处发现了一艘失事船只的残骸。

jushi.english: I saw children swimming in an old irrigation ditch alongside the rotting carcass of an ox.
jushi.chinese: 我看到孩子们在腐烂的牛尸旁边旧的灌溉渠里游泳。

jushi.english: We came across the carcass of a lion.
jushi.chinese: 我们遇见一具狮子的尸体。
